job_title: Director, Facilities Management in Hollister, CA

pros: Opportunity to help patients improve health

Small community
New Administration
CEO has great vision.
cons:
1. Internal financials indicate this hospital will not be financially viable over the next year. The CEO has mentioned this multiple times on record,
2. This is a free standing hospital, which means no financial back up. We attempted to get partnership with ANY hospital system, but we were turned down, this was 2018. It's 2021...usually takes a couple years to collapse. 
3. Multiple law suits. 
4. Multiple JCAHO violations, some extremely dangerous.
5. Overbilling. Not the fault of the hospital, a lot of hospitals over bill for services that were never rendered. 
6. No physician specialist. Only 24 hour hospitalist and one surgeon on call. If you are not 100% healthy, you will not receive the standard of care. 
7. Out of contract with most major insurance networks. 
8. I would advice anyone with a job here to start looking for a back up.







Reference: Search online for hazel hawkins financial trouble
Can get chaotic at times if there is an influx of visitors or patients

job_title: Registered Nurse%2C Emergency Room in San Jose, CA
Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Hollister, CA
pros: Nice small hospital, overall everyone is nice, Salary competative with other union hospitals in CA.
cons: Don't get regular breaks per union rules.  Small ICU, so if you are looking for experience,not the place to learn

pros: pay scale is competetive with nearby faciliies
cons: Somewhat backward,  has new building  with  less equipment,  outdated
